snippet: A deal brokered by the Clinton Health Access Initiative will halve the $18 price of Jadelle, which can work for up to five years.
abstract: German pharmaceutical company Bayer agrees to halve the price of Jadelle, implantable contraceptive used by 27 million women in poor countries; deal, made possible by several international donors, is brokered by the Clinton Health Access Initiative.
lead_paragraph: A deal brokered by the Clinton Health Access Initiative will halve the $18 price of Jadelle, which can work for up to five years.

headline.seo: Bayer Cuts Price of Contraception Implants for Poor
headline.main: International Donors Get Bayer to Cut Price 0f Implantable Birth Control for the Poor
headline.print_headline: International Donors Get Bayer to Cut Price Of Implantable Birth Control for the Poor
